a:r.a:t: Includes immune gateway inhibitors and other immunomodulators
Tumor-specific antigens from cancer cells are given to cancer patients to activate their immune system.
A cellular therapy in which the body's own immune cells are harvested, enhanced, genetically modified, and reintroduced.
Exploit the properties of antibodies that selectively bind to target antigens
Monoclonal antibodies are designed to bind to specific parts of cancer cells and can be very effective in treating cancer.
A replicating, immunogenic virus that inserts specific genes that target genetically abnormal sites in cancer cells.
